New Records: Florian Wirtz scored Germany's first goal after 10 minutes.
Jamal Musiala scored Germany's second goal on a well-taken shot.
Kai Havertz converted a penalty to give Germany a 3-0 lead.
Niclas Füllkrug scored Germany's fourth goal with a powerful strike.
Key Match Events: Ryan Porteous received a red card for a foul on Ilkay Gündogan.
Germany scored three goals in the first half, demonstrating strong teamwork.
Havertz' penalty conversion was a decisive moment in the match.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal, giving Scotland a glimmer of hope.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Clarke expressed frustration at Scotland's performance.
Scotland fans decorated Munich with wool-mix plaid ahead of the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke rued Scotland's poor start and defensive mistakes.
German players celebrated with the crowd, showing appreciation for the support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was covered in white Uefa vinyl flooring for the match.
The match was a near-perfect opening night for Germany.
Others: The match was held at the Munich Football Arena, known for its unique design.
Germany's performance showcased their talent and tactical acumen under Julian Nagelsmann.
